subject: fix(import): normalize JSON import to handle AI output guide format
body:
The JSON import was blindly casting raw data as GraphNode[]/Arc[] without
transformation. When AI assistants followed the output guide (which uses
`tags`, `typeName`, `isSystemNode`, `schemas`, version "1"), the data
was silently malformed — `tags` were lost, `typeName` ignored, and
required fields like `labels`, `viewData`, `properties` left undefined.

Added normalization layer in validateJsonImport that:
- Maps `tags` → `labels` (AI guide uses `tags`, internal model uses `labels`)
- Maps `typeName` → appends to `labels` (type classification as label)
- Merges `labels` + `tags` + `typeName` with deduplication
- Defaults missing fields: labels=[], properties={}, viewData={},
  content='', contentType='text/markdown', timestamps=now
- Strips legacy fields (isSystemNode, isSystemArc, schemas)
- Accepts both version "1" (guide format) and "2" (native export)

Markdown and CSV imports were already correct — only JSON path was broken.

Tags: import, json, normalization, ai-guide, compatibility
Complexity: 3
Urgency: 3
Impact: user-facing
Risk: low
Debt: paid
Epic: import-compatibility
Semver: patch
title: normalize JSON import to handle AI output guide format
